website_summaries.verdict: Choose this one if you are looking for a BMX model for a younger child – though it has a few quirks, it's a solid little bike that comes in ample size and color options.
pros: A good choice for the youngest BMX enthusiasts – both boys and girls – because it's available in a variety of sizes and colors
comes with water bottle, training wheels, and a bell
cons: Tires have been known to lose air
Potentially too heavy for some toddlers to handle

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the worst purchase I’ve made on amazon
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the worst purchase I’ve made on amazon. This bike is the epitome of Murphy’s law! Something is constantly falling off or breaking, one peddle is currently glued on and the brake pull doesn’t work. It makes me so angry the window to return the bike was so small not to mention the hassle returning the bike would have been anyways. This was such a waste of money-do not purchase- I’ll probably just have to get my son another bike :(
customer_reviews.author: E. Beck

customer_reviews.title: My 2 yr old loves her bike.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old girl cruises on this bike. She loves it. Her twin brother can't quite coordinate and push the pedals. Riding a bike is dependent on a kid's strength, coordination and determination. If your kid has all three then the 12' bike can be enjoyable for your kid as early as 2 yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: Rengam

customer_reviews.title: Really impressed with this bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike is really good quality, sturdy build, great tires, heavy duty training wheels. The water bottle and bell were a hit with my 4yo. The assembly was super easy, came with all the tools and took about 20 minutes! The14" was perfect for my 38" tall 4yo, with room to grow.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica A.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bike for my 3 year old grandson. After 30 minutes of use, the pedal assembly started making a clicking noise and the chain fell off the gear wheel. When we removed the chain cover we saw that the chain was so loose that it was remarkable that it had stayed on at all! We slid the rear wheel back to take up the slack, but then discovered that the pedal assembly was moving side to side in its casing. Then, 2 ball bearings fell out! None of these issues were due to assembly, which only requires attachment of the handlebars, pedals, and training wheels. Took about 30 minutes We returned it today for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Toujoursmax

customer_reviews.title: Heavy bike and difficult to pedal
customer_reviews.text: Both my boys tried riding this 16" bike while aged 4 thru 6. Both had difficulty riding this bicycle as it is very heavy and difficult to pedal forward. To contrast, I was given a hand-me-down Trek 20" boys bike and although it is larger it is several pounds lighter. My now 7 yr old had no difficulty riding this Trek bike. While this bike seems well-made and has bells and whistles, it's difficult to ride and is not used.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great, but I am concerned about rear reflector.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bike! Easy to put together and sturdy. I love that just comes with a kickstand and training wheels because I hope my daughter gains enough confidence to ride without training wheels on this bike. However the rear reflector can only be attached to the bike if the kickstand is not attached. That is okay for right now, but when the training wheels come off I'm not sure where the reflector is supposed to go. Only reason it is getting 4 stars is because of the rear reflector issue.
customer_reviews.author: Peace-A

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little bike
customer_reviews.text: Our son got this for his 3rd birthday. He's a little small for his age but it fit perfectly at the lowest setting. He quickly got the hang of peddling and thinks he's pretty cool on his bike like big brother. Assembly want to difficult and took about 20 minutes. I love that it's not a character themed bike and will grow with him. He loves the water bottle too.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Two right pedals
customer_reviews.text: Order this a few months ago for my daughters birthday present. My husband and I are putting it together now and we have two right pedals so it will not work. **Update** We ended up ordering new pedals so that we have a left and right but unfortunately have discovered that the water bottle leaks as well. I get people make mistakes hense the two right pedals but this bike just is not worth it for the money. We would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Had high expectations for this bike based of reviews. It fell way short of meeting those expectations. The quality of the bike is poor. The bike has a sloppy welding job, missing paint, a dent,etc. The bike quite heavy for a young child and my daughter finds it difficult to peddle due to the weight. Very disappointed and I would suggest looking at other options before purchasing this bike, as there seems to be no quality control done before shipping these bikes out. If returning it wasn't such a hassle I would. This bike is not worth the money, you could find a better alternative for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Rear wheel hub broken in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike about 11 months ago because it looked to be better quality than other bikes for this age range and I wanted to be able to hand this down once or twice. Liked the bike initially, but recently the pedals started free spinning with no motion transferring to the wheels. I took it to a repair shop and it turns out you can't replace just the hub (which had failed) but have to replace the entire back wheel. Repair cost in the 100 dollar range which is practically the cost of a new bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great first bike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike has been a great first bike for my 4 year old. We've had it for over a year and he still enjoys it-- the seat is easily adjustable. My only complaint is that it is a HEAVY bike. I've had to carry it back a block when my son has gotten tired/frustrated with riding his bike, and that wasn't fun.I liked that it came with a water bottle and holder. It gets hot in Texas and he needs it-- plus feels grown up!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlie M. Newberry

customer_reviews.title: BREAKS DO NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: CON(s): This bike arrived with a breaking the system that didn’t work. That’s a massive safety issue. I had to take it to a local bike shop to repair the breaks. I attempted to do so myself, as I am a cyclist and comfortable with bike parts but it wasn’t as simple as it should’ve been. Then, I’m very skeptical of the reviews that say what a great quality this bike is. I get that it’s a child’s bike but all the parts are complete garbage and so cheaply made. PRO: it was relatively easy to assemble. **if the break system cannot be fixed, I’ll attempt to return this item.
customer_reviews.author: JaMi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to know what this bike is really like, because it came with two left training wheels rather than a left and a right. Given that, we attached both, but since it's not the proper training wheel for the right side, it twists up and then is no longer useful, because it doesn't touch the ground. My daughter is 4, we got it for her birthday, and she can't use it. Further, it is a safety hazard for my child, as the bike tips over given we did not receive the correct part. I cannot find a way to contact the seller to get the correct part either, which is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: LJD

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Looks good. 2. Comes mostly assembled. Cons: 1. The handle bar is not sturdy. 3 days after tightening it, becomes lose again. 2. Back tire keeps losing air. After 10 hrs of riding on sidewalks, it is now completely flat. 3. Seat keeps moving as well. Needs periodic tightening. Not sure if we got a bad piece. After waiting close to two months to get this cycle (it was out of stock during the pandemic), we are extremely disappointed. Expected something a lot better for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sru

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift for my Son for 2019
customer_reviews.text: This bike was a huge hit for Christmas! My son wanted a Red Bike and that's just what he got from Santa! My husband and I were very surprised at the quality and how easy it was to assemble! It was packaged very well and we couldn't be happier with the bike! It has been extra handy for my son to have something to do for exercise and just having plain fun during this Pandemic! I'm soo thankful we bought this when we did because bicycles have been very scarce during this time. I would highly recommend this bike to anyone for their child!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Pretty heaving but good features
customer_reviews.text: Ive came to realization that your toddler will either fall in love with a bike or not based on his or her ability to use it and carry it. Due to the fact it is so heavy, our toddler is not wanting to use this bike. I would say its only usable with the training wheels on but once off, good luck with any toddler holding the bike upright. Other than weight, it has a very good built. My toddler loves the posterior bottle holder and comfortable seat. A bit heavy to pedal but better than a different bike we purchased in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Tahoesnow

customer_reviews.title: Cute bike but concerned about safety
customer_reviews.text: I missed the return window because I was waiting for my kid to grow into the bike. However I would have otherwise returned it. It’s really cute with the water bottle and bell (although the bell doesn’t have a vivid bell sound—more of a clank) it’s a nice touch. Obviously with a bike safety is the number one issue. With the bike pedals on this bike they keep falling off when my kid is riding and I have to screw them back on. They should have be pre installed or sturdier as that is unacceptable for a kids bike.
customer_reviews.author: Roharvs

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, easily broken made-in-China junk
customer_reviews.text: The bike is great for my four-year old, but after less than three months of light use, the front tire won't stay inflated-- seems to be a valve stem issue. I had expected to get a little more than three months out of this thing. UPDATE: Customer service was responsive and sent me a new inner tube for the tire, but that tube also had a leak. I wish I could give a negative star. 2ND UPDATE: Customer service sent two more replacement tubes. The first had a hole in it, the second was slashed. Both were completely useless. This company has *zero* quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Lugh

customer_reviews.title: Chinese garbage
customer_reviews.text: Bike looks great, but once again cheap Chinese quality. Pedals have so much play front to back, brake lever is only a few inches from the left handle so my son cannot out is hand in between the handle and the break lever. You get what you pay for. This was a Christmas gift for my 3 1/2 year old son. It’s already out together so I am not sending back instead I left it out on the curb for someone to take for their children. I will go and spend what it costs for a real well made bike. Don’t waste your money and time, but a name brand bike, you will thank me later.
customer_reviews.author: jtrizzy

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Well the bike gear box unraveled 3 days after the return window closed. Completely unusable. The chain fell off, I thought easy fix. The deeper I dug I realised that the ball bearings in the petal housing just fell out. 4 came loose and freely rattle around. This is crazy. The bike (a birthday present) didn’t last more than 3 weeks. Completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fantastic

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike!
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter thought this was the greatest thing she's ever had. Nice bike, well made, she really likes the hand brakes versus coaster brake. Solid well built. This bike cost 2-3 times the ones you buy at the big box stores and well worth it. Highly recommend spending the extra money and having something safe and dependable. I won't complain about the service, but the fact is we ordered Fuchsia color, my receipt said Fuchsia, but we received blue. Fortunately, my granddaughter like the color with the white fork and we never looked back. Might have been and issue with someone else. May want to have the shipping department look a little closer. going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Monster

customer_reviews.title: Lovely little bike, perfect for my 6.5 year-old
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves the bike and I love it too because of that. Be aware though, it is a BMX bike, so it is shorter (in length) than other normal 16" bikes. I was a bit surprised by it after assembling it, but it isn't a fault of the product. Assembly is simple and the package comes with all the tools you need. My daughter is learning how to ride without the training wheels, so I didn't put the training wheels on. There is a small handle at the back of the seat, so it is a perfect place for me to grab on to the bike while my daughter is learning to find the balance.
customer_reviews.author: spyder

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike for kids
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my niece to a bigger bike She is 9yr old and 88lbs and 54” in height I believe. the went from the 16” wheel to a 20” now. she loves the bike! Super easy to assemble. cons - this bike is a bit heavy for her to carry at times. I wish it came with the water bottle like the smaller sizes (I did purchase her the royal baby water bottle from their site, it was sold out on amazon, waiting for the bottle to arrive now) and we didn’t install the water splash pads for the front and back. I doubt she will ride in rain for muddy areas! hope you find this helpful!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bike
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves this bike. She had a cheap, heavy Disney princess bike that was not smooth and easy to pedal, and tired her out quickly, but with this bike she loves to go for long trips. The bearings (wheels and crank shaft) roll easy, and everything about the bike is quality. The brake handle fits her small hands and she can hold herself on slopes with it alone. The seat is comfy and easily adjusted with the quick release handle. If you want a child to have enthusiasm for bike riding, without spending too much, this is a great bike to start.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Top quality and an obvious choice
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo grew out of his older bike and moved away from his training wheels. For his 4th birthday we picked up the RoyalBaby Freestyle Kid’s Bike in blue and he absolutely loves it. As a parent, this was incredibly simple to assemble as it was basically put together in the box upon arrival. In addition, the bike is incredibly robust and feels like a tank that will survive the beating my son will exact upon it. Visually the bike is quite stunning with the tone of the blue matched with the white and black seat. The bike is a big hit with our family.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wise

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Easy to Assemble and Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Loved that there really are only 5 things you need to do to complete assembling the bike. The only downside is that they use the same instructions for all models, so you kind of have to be a little more aware about what instructions applies to your bike or not. But still it is pretty easy to figure out. I bought this for my son's birthday and he LOVED it! I'm considering replacing my older son's bike with this one. I love that it comes with a bell too (and so do the kids lol). A really well-made bike, no issues and we've been using it for about a week now.
customer_reviews.author: Breigha Adeyemo

customer_reviews.title: Bike is good, fenders break
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 6-7 year old boy, though he's on the tall side and it was plenty big. He still rides it over a year later and fit is still good, but the (mostly for decoration) fenders are a bad design and the child decided to take them off after issue with them. They can interfere with the tire spinning and one broke off on Christmas morning. The piece that holds the fender on would really need to be metal. It is nice to have them because it keeps mud puddles from spraying the child's back, but you may want to not put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke L.

customer_reviews.title: She started cycling herself with CONFIDENCE
customer_reviews.text: My 5 years little one started to learn cycling this summer for the first time. She tried an old borrowed cycle after removing pedal, as balanced bike for a week. I mean to say "16 inch" not the "20 inch" in video. Once this cycle arrived, within 2 hours she was peddling herself without me holding cycle back to give her balance. Must buy for little ones who love to enjoy summer with cycling in confidence.
customer_reviews.author: S Prasad

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT first bike
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this bike 1000 times over as a first bike. The assembly was so so easy, right down to the tires already being inflated. So easy. Such a great training bike. Loving it. The only thing that was NOT uber intuitive was the bottle holder, which was on a too low setting and therefore crammed into the back wheel, preventing it from moving. Was super silly. Seemed like a major design flaw. But I dissembled the bottle holder, extending the arm and then had to manually bend the arm in such a way to make it more agreeable and it was fine. A minor and annoying hiccup but once I figured it out everything worked smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Bike looks good, but unusable for me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a red color bike (14 inches) for my daughter. Although it looks striking, i could not get the left pedal into the threading hole. The right pedal went fitted smoothly but not the left.
customer_reviews.author: Wilfred

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level bicycle.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous bike for 4 year old. Easy for this grandma to put together. Seat is a lowest position as well as handlebars so he will be on this bike for awhile. 12” was too small, 16” too big. This is just perfect. Sturdy, not cheap lightweight plastic. He had no problem figuring out both the foot brake and hand brake. Not too heavy that he couldn’t pick the bike up when he fell off (thank you crappy uneven city sidewalks & pot hole streets) Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a beginner bike with training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: retiredRN

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: As someone who has worked in quality control in factories for many years, it is okay. The welding is average, but not refined. It could be better and the weld splatters could be sanded or grinded off. The decals are worst and horribly applied. The main decal on the gear cover was peeling off and looks like it was hastiley applied as well as other small decals. The overall integrity and durability seems good though, and it does have some options.
customer_reviews.author: ibes

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrates in Six Months
customer_reviews.text: Not super pleasant to assemble but kid loved the result. Rode great for a few months and then all of a sudden the chain started to come loose. That's fine one or two times but it became a common occurrence. I soon found out why - the ball bearings in the axel of the pedal started falling out which caused the pedals to loosen. Only a few months of use and the bike is now completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank H.

customer_reviews.title: READ THE DIRECTIONS, I PROMISE YOU WON’T LOSE YOUR MAN CARD
customer_reviews.text: This is a bitchin bike! My son loves it! He is 3 years old and 34 lbs, maybe like 3ft? My husband hates it, but that is probably because he was too manly to read the directions and it took twice as long to put together. If it is hard for your hold to peddle, loosen the chain a bit. I am not sure if that is common knowledge for everyone else, but we were absolutely clueless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, plastic parts, lots of Baby logos on it.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't care for weight of bike and plastic parts. Also not a fan of "Royal Baby" logos. What kid wants baby on the bike. Heavy rolling resistance initially, improved with time. Kid liked the water bottle the best. Ended up going for a Mongoose Legion 18" bike instead and it worked out well for my 5 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O.

customer_reviews.title: HOW?
customer_reviews.text: The bike is nice, but here it is 6 days later and I and several men have tried to get the right side bolt off to put the training wheel. Grandson can’t ride his bike while siblings can!😞 So grandma has to take it to Walmart tire shop or somewhere and ask them to use a power tool to loosen it! I don’t know how on earth that is on so tight! First we thought maybe we are turning it the wrong way...
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: We broke one of the white training wheels more than a year after we purchased it (I dropped it down hard!). I wrote to the manufacturer, to see how I could get a simple replacement wheel. They sent me a new wheel at no charge, didn't even charge me shipping. It arrived 2-days after my email. I'll be buying the next size up soon. A+ customer service. And, the bike is excellent - we leave it outdoors year around and it's barely showing signs of wear (a little rust here and there, but nothing like my $500 bikes show).
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Toddler Bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike totally made my son's day on his birthday. This is an awesome and cool looking bike for a three year old. The bright green and white combo is very sharp. I got the smallest height and it's perfectly fine for him with plenty of growing room (he's just over 3 ft tall!). You can easily adjust the handle bars and seat. The seat is very comfortable, the brakes work great, and it comes with a bell and water bottle. It is very durable and worth the amount paid. My son had trouble riding it the first day but easily caught on and he's doing great. We are very pleased with the purchase and would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my 7 year old son who has known how to ride bikes since he was 3. The overall shape and structure of the bike is very uncomfortable. The screws loosen up every day or two and a little force on the bike causes the handle bars and wheels to dis-align. MY SON FELL OFF THE BIKE BECAUSE IT ONLY COMES WITH A FRONT BRAKE WHICH IS VERY DANGEROUS AND HE ENDED UP NEEDING SURGERY ON HIS RIGHT ARM/ELBOW. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND YOU DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: tsewang123

customer_reviews.title: TOOOO HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: Cute bike, but WAY too heavy for little ones. My LO had a balance bike for 2 years. She was ready for a real bike (without training wheels). This is made for an approxx 60 pounder (without training wheels). We had to return it because she was so frustrated and had no interest in it. We ended up purchasing a WOOM bike. More expensive, but lighter and worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Legalchica

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool and strong construction
customer_reviews.text: i haven't used it yet. or my son hasn't used it much yet. It's a bit tall for him and the seat wide but he'll get there soon enough. Looks cool and strong construction...almost too strong. I wish they made a lighter version but then I'm sure it would cost more. Attached is a photo of this bike compared to a strider balance bike.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbles-Desmo

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Such a cute bike. I got it for the 2yr olds birthday. He said "wow wow wow" and hugged it after it was assembled. It feels very solid and sturdy. Love the wide wheels for better stability. It looks great and feels like great quality. Assembly was no problem. The bell is loud! Very happy with the purchase and so is the little guy! The seat goes low enough and handle bars can can adjusted down for his small size. He is just a tiny munchkin so I was afraid it would be much too big, but the adjustments accommodate him.
customer_reviews.author: MyPenNameTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: I cannot say enough good things about this bike
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this bike. Its tough. Its durable. Its so stinking cute I want one for myself. This was purchased for my daughter's 7th birthday and we are thrilled with it. Not sure if she's more enamored with the water bottle holder (our previous Hello Kitty didn't offer this amenity) or the bell but its a 10 star at our house. Very good quality on the build per my welder husband to keep him happy and flashy enough for my daughter and I. High five to RoyalBaby for using tires perfect for country life of gravel and grass instead of thinking we all live with perfectly paved driveways.
customer_reviews.author: jbvg

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Sixteen inch bike arrives one week before promised. Easily assembled. Looks good and our five year old grandson loves it. A bit heavy for him to carry by himself, but not a problem. I would rather it be sturdy. Tires with off road type tread which works well on the farm but not tough enough to withstand stickers. Solved by adding sealer to the tube; no more problem.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B

customer_reviews.title: Pricey for what you get
customer_reviews.text: We had to reorder due to the bike being too big for my 3 year old. I went by the sizing chart and it was way off for my son. I should’ve measured so that’s on me. The bike is cute. Everything seems to work. I was surprised at how pricey a tiny bike is especially with the way the parts are fused together. That makes it look sloppy but my son likes it so that’s all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bike
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Royal Baby Freestyle. First purchased a 14" bike two years ago, which has lasted well and has now been passed down to a younger sibling, although the bell broke at some point early on. We've now purchased a 16" bike and are happy with it. I like that it has handle brakes in addition to pedal brakes. The kickstand works well. I was surprised to notice that the front stem is white, even on the blue bike, but when I looked closely at the pictures online, I see that I should not have been surprised.
customer_reviews.author: megara

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little bike
customer_reviews.text: Great looking bike. Bought this for my 4 year old who is absolutely in love with it. Super easy to assemble, very nice quality and would recommend to anyone. I have no idea how the training wheels are because my son never needed them but them seemed like good quality in the box. Came with a couple reflectors, a bell a water bottle mount and bottle to go with it. The bright blue is exactly as pictured and the seat seems very comfortable for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: Left Pedal broke on first ride, pic in review... And a heavy bike.
customer_reviews.text: We got the bike of our kid on time, assembly wasn’t tough. Took like 15 mins to assemble. The left pedal was pretty tricky to put but somehow managed it. Mind you the bike is pretty heavy for a 14 inch bike. And took my kid on a bike ride, and the left pedal broke right after riding for half a mile or so. And it was again tough to put I back in. Perhaps I got a bad piece, not sure what should I do if it repeatedly brakes. Pictures attached from the ride.
customer_reviews.author: Nisarg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fun!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bike as a gift for our grandson's 5th birthday. It's just the right size and is very durable. The only issue we had was the fact that one of the valve stems was not functional and needed to be replaced. Otherwise, it went together easily with just minimal tools. Now to teach the boy some traffic safety and rules of the road. Thank goodness for helmets and safety gear.
customer_reviews.author: Birte K. Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Bike!
customer_reviews.text: We are thoroughly happy with this bike. It arrived on time, well packaged, and already mostly assembled. It has clear instructions, and took only 5 minutes to put the finishing touches on assembly. The bike is sturdy too, which is super important because our son is a brute haha. I purchased a pack of 100 stickers on Amazon when I purchased the bike, so our son could put all of his favorite heros on his bike. It all came together very well and he loves his new bike!
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike for kid, outer box Is not good for shipping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my kid. He loved it. The bike is sturdiness and looks for high quality. The assemble is easy; I have a screwdriver to assemble it. However, the package is terrible. The delivery representative told me that the outer box is not solid and easy broken. Which in my case, yes. The whole outer box is pretty mush broken. Luckily the inner product is solid and did not affect. I was initially worried about the missing parts, but luckily the delivery worker told me that he double check his truck to make sure there is no left part.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Lin

customer_reviews.title: 18” Does Not Have Training Wheels
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this bike for my sons birthday. It came mostly assembled so you just had to put on handlebars and peddles. Pretty easy! Perfect bike for him. But he’s not quite to riding it just yet. In the description it said with training wheels but in the 18” bike, it does not come with training wheels. I had to buy separately and put those on too.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren  Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Too Heavy
customer_reviews.text: My 6 (going on 7) year old twins have finally outgrown this bike. It is a quality bike, but it is so insanely heavy, which is a challenge for the kids to really push it. Especially it became a problem with having them learn to balance without training wheels. I have two full sized adult bikes that weigh half of what this does, but of course the trade off is price. Looking back, I regret not paying a little more for a light bike.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Dont go by reviews
customer_reviews.text: I got this bike in 14inch frame for my son and ever since we got it, something or the other keeps falling apart. I am not sure how many of the reviews they have of this bike are true now, as it was one of the factors that went in me making that decision. The only reason I am giving it two stars instead of one is their support, they have been responsive and sending me in replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Jayesh Kalro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We bought a high-end first bike for our oldies thinking it would be great. Wrong. High end bikes are great at selling to the triathalon trainees. Not so go at selling to the potty-trainers. We have bought a couple of sizes of this bike and we went with neutral colors to share between genders. The kids love them. The gender neutral colors allow the kids to decide how they might want to personalize it (stickers, bells, reflectors, etc) without making so it could not be passed on to the next kid.
customer_reviews.author: GoArmyBeatNavy!

customer_reviews.title: Great bike! For size go by child's height, not age
customer_reviews.text: This bike is awesome! But be sure to gauge the bike size by the "kid's height" column, not by the age column. Our son is 3 so we went with 14" (says 3-5 years) so he can use it for awhile. However he's only 35.5" tall and the 14" bike is too big (says 37.4-47.2" tall)... probably won't be able to use it till next year! But he's getting his use out of the water bottle... he's never drank so much water in his life! He loves that thing.
customer_reviews.author: CM_Denver

customer_reviews.title: Missing wheels
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 bikes, one green and the other was blue. The bikes looked great and I wasn’t aware they came with training wheels. However, only the green bike had training wheels and the blue cane without them. I actually bought 2 sets of training wheels but they did not fit because of the bike’s construction so I’m returning them. This lead me to buy an additional set which is the same brand name as the bike. I hope Amazon could send the apropriate wheels at no charge since they should have been included as they were with the other royal baby bike.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Prestia-Cassuto

customer_reviews.title: perfect purchase (3 year old boy)
customer_reviews.text: Finding a bike small enough and sturdy enough was a task but this bike was worth every penny. Son started riding with training wheels pretty early on based on how much control he had with this bike. It was the perfect size. He was a slightly tall 3 year old and it was perfect for him down to making him feel extra cool because it had a water bottle holder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good looking bike
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike. We bought the 16 nice orange and white one for a 4 year old. He is still getting the hang of it. The bike has good features. Foot breaks, water bottle holder, training wheels, kick stand for when he gets older. We are happy with the purchase. Two things to note, the plastic cover to the chain came chipped and the tools it came with to assemble were not as good as our own tools. Net net good price purchases though.
customer_reviews.author: Maria C Hidalgo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome first pedal bike!
customer_reviews.text: Great first bike! I got this for my sons 3rd birthday and it is perfect. He has been using a 12” strider, and I got him this 14”. He hopped right on and took off like he’s been riding for years!! It was suuuuuuper easy to assemble. I didn’t put the training wheels in, but assume they would be easy too. He is very happy with his own water bottle too, and the little bell is added fun. This bike even supports me! Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Murray

customer_reviews.title: My 4 yr old & 7 yr old LOVE THESE BIKES!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of looking in stores, online and reviews. I wanted nice bikes for my boys but not expensive sence they will put grow it. They love their new bikes and came in their favorite colors, bonus! I love making the kids laugh and being silly (i'm 5'2 and 113 lbs) so I rode them lol Both rode really nice, very sturdy and comfortable to! Just like the kids said Lol We will continue to purchase this brand
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! We got the 14-in model for my 4-year-old boy. He loves it and the bike has held up well. We've been using it for 1.5 years. He is now 5 and the 14 inch model is just a bit on the small side, but it will still work out for a few more months. I'd recommend 14" for 4 year old, or 16" for 5 year old, depending on how tall they are for their age.
customer_reviews.author: brandon05mn

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This one arrived today. So far I was very happy that I bought this for my son, I wanted to buy another one for my daughter but didn’t have the pink colored one. It is sturdy, easy to install., 95% was already assembled. Even the tools you’d need to assemble few items are in the box as well. Unlike the bike I bought for my daughter, which by the way more expensive than this one. It was 50% assembled and no tools included. I didn’t regret buying this Royal baby bike, it’s worth the price. It’s little heavier than I anticipated but it feels like durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get the kids going!!
customer_reviews.text: Got these a couple of months ago and the kids have been riding them all summer. The setup process was fine, no problems. The first month, the pedals kept coming loose, so had to do some tightening of bolts across the whole bike. To be expected. Did have to add kick stands which was more of a pain than building the bike. So far so good and will be a work horse this fall and into next summer before the next upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: MNPilot

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, heavy bike
customer_reviews.text: It's a good bike, but SO heavy. My kiddo is on the thin side, so often he would have the strength to make the tires spin, but the bike wouldn't move, so he'd just be spinning the wheel. Also, since it's so heavy, sometimes he had trouble steering it out of areas that got suddenly steep, like the where a driveway meets the sidewalk. Also, when he went over, there was little chance of him catching himself because of the weight.He loved having his own water bottle holder though.
customer_reviews.author: S. Massaro

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy.  Ergonomics are terrible.  My kiddo never rides it.
customer_reviews.text: Too heavy. Ergonomics are terrible. My kiddo never rides it. Wish I could return it. +/- year after initial review- kiddo still won’t ride this pos.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy, pretty bicycle..!! Great product..!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these in August/2018.. one for my son (blue, 12 in) & one for my daughter (red, 16 in). They love their bikes..!! This is a well made bike from frame, wheels, training wheels, paint job, hand brake, reflectors. Easily put together with directions. The kids have been riding them daily. Thank you Royalbaby for making great bicycles for the children. I’m extremely satisfied and highly recommend these to parents who want to purchase a good sturdy and pretty bicycle, not just for the look of the bike..!! Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bella Triad

customer_reviews.title: Overall great bike but left pedal keeps falling off
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd bike from them. 12 inch he rode without the training wheels from 3-4, then we bought the 16inch at 4 1/2 and fits perfectly. The problem is his left foot pedal keeps falling off the bike every time he rides it, which is dangerous if he it standing on the pedals vs sitting. Not sure if we can tighten better or needs a new pedal
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is a little small for an 8 year old. He had outgrown his 16 but was still a little too small for the 20 so the 18 was perfect. It was easy to assemble according to my husband and my son says it's the best bike ever because he finally has a handle break and kick stand. The only reason why it's not perfect is because with the seat in the lowered position for my little guy the water bottle doesn't fit in the holder. Not really a deal breaker. As he grows and raises the seat he can use the water bottle holder.
customer_reviews.author: DL Nuggets

customer_reviews.title: Junk=Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased two of these bikes in the last 9 months. Both have basically fallen apart. We really liked the bike initially because it looks great and is fairly light in weight. That said, on both bikes the ball bearings came out of the pedal causing the chain to fall off over and over again. There is no way to access the pedal to repair the bracket. The most recent bike was purchased on June 25, 2018 and broke just over three months later on September 30, 2018. Of course we are beyond the return timeline so we're just out $120-plus. I WOULD NOT recommend this bike if you want something that will last more than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Kearns

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy for 3yo to pedal
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed in this bike. It was more than I’d hoped to spend for our first pedal bike, but reviews were excellent. It’s well built and handsome, but it is one huge problem. It is SO HEAVY. It’s really difficult for my son to pedal, it takes a lot of strength and momentum that little legs really can’t do! It’s even hard for me to pick up and carry when we are taking it out of the garage.
customer_reviews.author: EVO SVO

customer_reviews.title: Functional - Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Daughter's first "big girl" pedal bike. She's been on a balance bike until now. Packaging was a tad ugly (holes, scuffs, etc), but nothing was damaged. Bike went together in about 15 minutes, I had no issues with wheel alignment or caliper adjustment for the brake lever. She's already begun pedaling for about 20 feet on her own... I figure by the end of the week she'll be whipping around the block on it with her big brother.
customer_reviews.author: T. Taphorn

customer_reviews.title: Continuous Flat Tire
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool bike as a whole but the back tire goes flat over and over again within minutes. We have replaced the ube to the bike twice, filed down the inside of the rim and continue to have the same issue. It has been a giant pain. Needing to buy another bike now because we are getting to the point of it not being worth continuing to replace the tube.
customer_reviews.author: caleb c.

customer_reviews.title: Love this bicycle!
customer_reviews.text: Great bike this was our first time buying a bike for our 31/2 year old boy we bought a 16 inches we are totally satisfied with our purchase. Easy to assembly our boy is not scare to get on it because is very steady and strong super cute and great size for him I didn’t want to waste my money in something he will use few month this bike will last few year we totally recommend this bicycle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tires came flat and won't stay inflated; needed tube sealent
customer_reviews.text: The tires came flat which I thought was due to having been shipped to Hawaii. However, they deflated again after a few hours. I was going to return it (a pain as it is bulky and assembled and it would disappoint my little ones). I found a tube sealant and added it to my cart and contacted customer service. They agreed to pay for the sealant as a cheaper alternative to a return. Hopefully the sealant will work.
customer_reviews.author: MEL

customer_reviews.title: Safety concerns. Needs special attention assembly
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install at first. Little assembly required. So too easy and leaves things untightened. You don't know what needs to be tightened or adjusted such as handle bar or training wheels and seat and break until your child is riding a bit. At that point it could be dangerous. The handle bars snapped on easily like in instructions but after a long distance ride the bar stopped controlling the tire. My child started inadvertently going in the wrong direction that she was steering. This was scary and confusing to my child. The bike is solid heavy durable and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Ko

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 1/2 yr old had outgrown her 12" bike and we were looking for a bigger bike. We debated between the 16" and 18" versions and decided to go with the 18" because she's been riding without training wheels since 2 1/2. It was the right choice. She really loves the bike - her favorites are the bell and water bottle/holder. It's a sturdy, well-built bike and should last her several years until her younger sisters will start using it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lilly

customer_reviews.title: Brakes malfunctioning, spring jammed, break pads poor quality with not enough resistance. Avoid!!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the bike and didn't use for first several months as my kid wasn't ready for it. Started using it recently and found that brakes are malfunctioning. One side of the brake springs is not moving at all, and other side brake stays applied even after it is released. Break pad is poor quality as well, it barely provide any resistance to break effectively. What's the point of paying a premium for this bike and not getting a much cheaper one from Walmart etc. when these are shipped without proper testing with brakes defective and malfunctioning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike- Great price and features- GREAT value!
customer_reviews.text: The bikes were easy to assemble. A tool is provided. A lot of pre-assembly has been done before the bike arrives. So, if you buy from a name bike store, you are going to pay more than double, and not get anything better (been there, done that). Easy to adjust seat, and the chain guard is great for first-timers when training wheels come off. We bought green and blue, and the colors/paint jobs are top shelf! You can't go wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: J. T. Weir

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to assemble and it is sturdy. We were hesitant about this purchase because the reviews stated that it was too hard to pedal but our son had no problem. He loves everything about it: the color, the bell, the water bottle. A worthy purchase. Glad we splurged.
customer_reviews.author: Gaadi Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Flat tires
customer_reviews.text: What goin on with it? I brought two bikes for my boy girl twins. My daughters bike needed air within a week. Thought nothing of it. Put air in. She road it once after. The second time she attempted to ride it, it needed air again. Now it’s catching dust. And so is his since he cant ride if she can’t.
customer_reviews.author: Cassy T.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: This Bike is AWESOME!! Great quality, and our 4 year old daughter could ride the 14" bike great without training wheels. Bummed it didn't come with a kickstand, but training wheels, as we didn't need them, wish there was an option to choose. The White is Sparkly!! We were very excited about that. Only negative is the water bottle rack is easily bent, so full water bottle can weigh it down and will touch tire. Over all we are very happy with the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent 1st bike Choice
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. My son is 7yrs and 18' works well for him. BUT wish it had the training wheel option. It is his first bike and it was not an option on the 18" for some reason??? Any way to get them separately? I am getting tired running behind him with my hand under the seat. Also, sure wish it did not say Royal Baby on tires and the other places. Literally printed all in the tire tread, the handlebar bracket and other places. Big mistake when selling to age group that can read. Let me know about those training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Title-Guy

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: Description clearly says, includes training wheels. The first bike came without them. The box clearly say training wheels included. The directions tell you how install them. Returned it. 2nd bike was the same. I agreed to accept a partial refund and purchase my own training wheels. I then discovered you can't install them due to the axle is too short. Fed up trying and returned it too. I tried contacting Royal Baby but couldn't. The phone number and email is in China. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Posey

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my 3-yr old son. It is a very nice bike with great quality. It took me some time to assemble this bike, but it looks beautiful. Everything works well, but don’t let your child play with the bell too hard. ( mine was broken after my son twisted the base for a while) . This bike is a little heavy, but I think it is a great activity for kids at this age.
customer_reviews.author: Jia

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: The bike is attractive, sturdy, my great-granddaughter can ride it on our long dirt driveway with no problem. My great-granddaughter is proud and thrilled to have it. She is 6 1/2, 45" tall, and 44 lbs. The bike is the perfect size for her. The only things that were wrong, were the bell did not work, and the bottle holder was on up-side-down. No big deal. We ordered a fancier bell, and turned the bottle holder the right way.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Verenbec

customer_reviews.title: Superb first bike!
customer_reviews.text: My 5-y-o is absolutely loving this bake! It's tough and the fat tires make it great for off-road riding. He can go anywhere I go on my mountain bike. I bought him a little pedal-less balance bike when he was two and he mastered that so I never had to put the training wheels on this. He just needed a little time to learn to pedal and hop off when he stopped but he's loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Goodin

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: 100 so far in repairs, This bike has been in the shop constantly, have had to replace the seat, front brake assembly and the chain snapped on the second ride. Very disappointed in the quality of this bike, seller refused to refund because my son had ridden the bike and therefore the bike was no longer in new condition.. Will not consider one of these brand bikes in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the $$~
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this little bike! Very well built, sturdy, not wobbly on the training wheels. Adjustable for a tiny tot to a taller one! Just can't say enough about this bike and the company~ We will be ordering a bigger one as our guy grows! Price is right; so much better than any we looked at in the big box stores!... Even their customer service was a notch above all the rest. Contacted them online and question was answered immediately!! Thank you Royalbaby!!
customer_reviews.author: JRN

customer_reviews.title: Tons better than any Walmart/Target bike!
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent purchase. The all aluminum frame is super light. It’s perfect for an 8 year old who is now on his second real bike. I compared this bike to the standard Huffy or Mongoose they sell at Walmart and Target. This bike was about the same price and is excellent. It’s light. It’s cool. The hand brakes are super. My son who is 8 can squeeze them and stop the bike unlike some of the other bikes where the brakes were very stiff. Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Kilbane

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, great bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike is for my 5yr old, he loves the water bottle and stickers that came with it. He liked decorating it! It was very easy to assemble! Love that! I was able to do it by myself, with the tools provided in the packaging! I don't like that the training wheels kept coming lose, we have to keep tightening them. So the tool in the kit doesn't help with that. The tires were pretty low when it arrived so I had to purchase a pump before he could ride it. Those are the only two things that were bad about this bike. I think it's a great deal for the money we spent! He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Horribly heavy machine
customer_reviews.text: This bike is terribly heavy for a child! My 4-year-old son just can’t ride it. the bike weighs more than 22 pounds. I did not understand when I bought that it was too much. Unfortunately, a lot of good reviews here puzzled me. I bought it for birthdays and unfortunately experienced great disappointment. Most importantly, the baby was very upset as he chose it by color. I could not return it on time, but now the time has passed. I really do not recommend anyone to buy such a bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid starter bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought the version with 12" wheels. This bike is easy to assemble, and the components feel sturdy and rugged. I assembled it with no problems in about 15 minutes and I was taking my time. My 3-1/2 year old son loves it and it's easy for him to begin learning how to pedal forward because pedaling backward activates the hub brake. He's already zipping around in front of our house and loves the bike and the cool green color. This bike seems like it will last a long time and is definitely a good starter bike for young kids.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick Fortuna

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware. These tubes are non-standard and not easily available in the U.S.
customer_reviews.text: The bikes appear to be produced and sold by a Chinese company hence the components are less available in the US especially now with the trade disputes going on. -The bike is great. My daughter loves it. But a year after purchase, we finally popped a tube and it's turning out to be more trouble than it's worth to repair this bike. Standard tubes go up to 2.25"; this one is a 2.4". I found some on an asian market, but they cost $35 to ship $4 tubes. Royal Baby doesn't appear to offer replacement parts via their website.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B

customer_reviews.title: They LOVE them, perfect size and after a little coaching ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 2.5 year old and 3.5 year old. They LOVE them, perfect size and after a little coaching on using the pedals and braking they are running circles around the house til the ice and snow melt outside. Santa (my husband) was amazed at how easy assembly was. He was expecting an all nighter on Christmas Eve and was super impressed. These bikes are solidly built and perfect as an entry into "big kid" bike territory for my preschoolers.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Great looking, solid bike. Much nicer than picture shows.
customer_reviews.text: The pictures do not do this bike justice. It is gorgeous. My grandson loves it, his parents love it, and we are very pleased with the purchase. For those who are concerned about the "Royal Baby" engisnia, I found it imprinted on the tires but not on the seat and neither my grandson, his parents, nor his grand parents found it off putting. The bike is a brilliant blue and the wide tires look rough & tough. The training wheels are nice and wide. He jumped right on and could sit upright with no problem. The bell was a big hit too. Love this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart
customer_reviews.text: The bearings fall apart in the pedals and the chain falls off. My son loved this bike when he first got it and about two years into having it, it started to fall apart. We got replacement bearings from the manufacturer and the other day those fell apart too! It's a great bike for the first year but don't waste your money as you will have to replace it in two.
customer_reviews.author: sami kowalzek

customer_reviews.title: FLAT FRONT TIRE
customer_reviews.text: The bike looks great but is heavy. The worst thing is the front tire will not stay inflated. We have to inflate the front tire every day. It was flat when we got it. That's a huge inconvenience. Don't know if they will send a replacement tire. The other bothersome thing is the training wheels are not even so it wobbles making my grandson afraid to use it. They are not adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Bad tire and water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike in July for my grandson but held it til now to give at Christmas since he was still a little too small, only to find out that one tire will not inflate and the water bottle cap does not stay closed. It has now been too long to be able to return it. If there is anything that can be done to resolve this, it would be greatly appreciated. We would love to still give this bike as a gift next week. A new tire? A new water bottle? We love the bike and would love to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For Buff Children Only
customer_reviews.text: These bikes are SO heavy. It's a chore to load them up to take to the park. My 3 year old can't peddle up the hill because it's so heavy. I would make sure to enroll your kids in some CrossFit before getting this bike; they'll need to get jacked before they can use it. Bonus - you'll end up carrying it back up the hill and get super strong and fit.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

product_meta.title: RoyalBaby Kids Bike Boys Girls Freestyle Bicycle 12 14 16 inch with Training Wheels,16 18 20 inch with Kickstand Child's Bike Blue Red Orange Green Pink White Fuchsia
product_meta.description: RoyalBabys newly developed Freestyle bike for boys and girls offers factory direct sales with favorable retail price. They are the most famous and best selling kid bike brand in China, with patented components featuring outstanding designs and quality. They are built to be compliant with CPSC and ISO standards. The bikes also come with unique strong individual packaging that is easy to carry which improves safe delivery. Available in 12, 14, 16 and 18 inch wheels. Creative colors to choose for your little riders' favor.
feature_bullets: 1. Easy to put together. 95% of the bike is assembled. Save your headache to install the front wheel and brake compared with 85% bikes. Assembly tools and an easy to follow instructions are included.

2. Safer riding! Safe grips and handbrake, Front caliper brake and rear coaster brake offer double safer, Wide 2.4” pneumatic tires add more stability, Sturdy steel frame,Crank, Non-slip resin pedal,Chainguard.
3. Easier to Ride! Your little ones will enjoy a smoother ride with Royalbaby sealed bearing since 2019, Royalbaby exclusive brake lever allows little riders brake efficiently.

4. Amazing design and color! Bright colors, stylish and charming. Bike bell and DIY decal add extra fun to the ride. Soft seat comes with a handle, which makes the bike easier to grab during teaching or loading.
5. More size options! 12,14,16,18,20 Inch available. Use our easy-to-follow size chart, you’ll find a perfect size for your little beloved. Note: Please take the kids height into consideration.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
